body.p: In its deliberations leading to the 2010 Hedge Accounting Exposure Draft, the IASB considered three alternative approaches to hedge accounting in order to address situations in which credit risk is hedged by credit derivatives. Those alternatives would, subject to qualification criteria, permit an entity with regard to the hedged credit exposure (for example, a bond, loan or loan commitment):

li.p: to elect fair value through profit or loss only at initial recognition;
to designate a component of nominal amounts; and
to discontinue fair value through profit or loss accounting.

to elect fair value through profit or loss at initial recognition or subsequently (if subsequently, the difference between the then carrying amount and the then fair value is recognised immediately in profit or loss);
to designate a component of nominal amounts; and
to discontinue fair value through profit or loss accounting.
to elect fair value through profit or loss at initial recognition or subsequently (if subsequently, the difference between the then carrying amount and the then fair value is amortised or deferred);
to designate a component of nominal amounts; and
to discontinue fair value through profit or loss accounting.
